parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Eleven. From heis and deka; one and ten, i.e. Eleven.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Left, left behind, the remainder, the rest, the others. Masculine plural of a derivative of leipo; remaining ones.
